head.title: Woman Arrested in Princeton Bomb Threat

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New Jersey

hedline.hl1: Woman Arrested in Princeton Bomb Threat
hedline.hl2: Woman Arrested in Princeton Bomb Threat

abstract.p: Police arrest Geraldine M Dametz for calling in bomb threat on Princeton University, two days after calling in similar threat on another New Jersey campus (S)

block.p: A woman from Long Branch, N.J., was arrested yesterday after she called in a bomb threat from an academic building at Princeton University, two days after calling in a similar threat on another New Jersey campus, the police said.

The woman, Geraldine M. Dametz, 46, called the police in Long Branch, on the Jersey Shore, about 11 a.m. yesterday, saying she was at Princeton with a bomb, said Chief Charles Davall of the Princeton Borough police. She told the police that she ''wouldn't go peacefully,'' he said.

A woman from Long Branch, N.J., was arrested yesterday after she called in a bomb threat from an academic building at Princeton University, two days after calling in a similar threat on another New Jersey campus, thepolice said.

A woman from Long Branch, N.J., was arrested yesterday after she called in a bomb threat from an academic building at Princeton University, two days after calling in a similar threat on another New Jersey campus, the police said.

The woman, Geraldine M. Dametz, 46, called the police in Long Branch, on the Jersey Shore, about 11 a.m. yesterday, saying she was at Princeton with a bomb, said Chief Charles Davall of the Princeton Borough police. She told the police that she ''wouldn't go peacefully,'' he said.

Chief Duvall added that Ms. Dametz had had ''a personal disenchantment'' with a man who now works at Princeton University and used to work at Monmouth University in Long Branch, where she also once worked. Monmouth was the target of the first threat.
Officers in Long Branch called the campus police, who tracked Ms. Dametz to the Wallace Social Sciences Building, Chief Davall said.
Police officers, Mercer County sheriff's deputies and a state police bomb squad rushed to the campus. Ms. Dametz was found in a conference room and arrested. No bomb was found.
